alert.note: Alert for Grundy; Southern Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued January 17 at 8:14PM CST until January 22 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by the sudden shifting or break up of an ice jam is possible. * WHERE...The lower Kankakee River from near Wilmington downstream to the confluence with the Illinois River, including portions of Grundy and Will counties. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Dangerous ice flows or shifting of ice may damage structures along the shore. Additional roads and streets may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A significant ice jam is located on the Kankakee River near the confluence with the Illinois River to just upstream of Wilmington. The ice jam is holding back a significant amount of water. Sudden shifting or breaking of ice may occur at any time over the next several days, which could cause new flooding with limited advanced notice. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means flooding is possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Persons with interests along the Kankakee River should be prepared to take action should additional flooding develop.
